title: Dani Dyer hits back at Love Island showmance claims with ex Jack Fincham
text:
Dani Dyer slams claims her romance with Love Island’s Jack Fincham was ‘fake’ (Picture: WireImage)

Love Island 2018 winner Dani Dyer has hit back at claims her relationship with Jack Fincham was fake.

In an interview to promote her new reality dating TV show with her dad, Danny, she said: ‘I know what I am and I would never fake a relationship.

‘It was beautiful. We had a great summer. It just didn’t work out. People are in love and sometimes it doesn’t work out.

‘That’s what happened with us. The British public aren’t stupid. They watched us for eight weeks. They’d suss us out.’

Jack and Dani split up just six months after taking out the top spot and leaving the Love Island villa.

The 23-year-old will replace Maya Jama as the host for season two of MTV show True Love or True Lies.

Dani Dyer is the new host of MTV’s True Love of True Lies (Picture: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)

The format of the show sees eight couples (some real and some fake) compete to win £50,000 while staying in a villa in Malta.

She’s joined by her dad – who does the narration for the show – in her first ever hosting gig.

Dani added to the Mirror: ‘It’s such a “pinch me” ­moment, having my own show. I never thought it would happen.

‘It’s lovely working with my dad, ­although I didn’t see him when filming.’

Not long to go now! 💜 Play along with Dani and Danny Dyer for 12 nights starting Mon 21st Oct! Have you got what it takes to spot the fakes? 👀🤔 pic.twitter.com/GfHHRx1e2B — True Love or True Lies? (@mtvloveorlies) October 15, 2019

Dani and Jack officially broke up in April, and the former barmaid got back together with old flame Sam Kimmence, soon after.

When Dani recently faced the haters directly, she shared some happy shots of her and Sammy and wrote: ‘I’m not going to delete anyone’s comments. You all can say what you want to say honestly we live in a free world. But I’m so f happy (sic).

‘I ain’t living a life to prove people or to fake to people I am something I am not I’ve always been real.

‘Some people like it some people don’t. I’m focusing on number one.’

True Love or True Lies starts on Monday 21 October at 9pm.
